verses.kjv: Then Joshua called the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh,
verses.web: Then Joshua called the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,
verses.ct: Joshua summoned the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Ye have kept all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded you, and have obeyed my voice in all that I commanded you:
verses.web: and said to them, “You have kept all that Moses the servant of LORD commanded you, and have listened to my voice in all that I commanded you.
verses.ct: He told them, "You have obeyed everything that Moses, the servant of the LORD, commanded you. And you've followed every order I gave you as well.

verses.kjv: Ye have not left your brethren these many days unto this day, but have kept the charge of the commandment of the LORD your God.
verses.web: You have not left your brothers these many days to this day, but have performed the duty of the commandment of LORD your God.
verses.ct: All this time — through many long days right up to today — you never abandoned your fellow Israelites. You faithfully carried out what the LORD your God required of you.

verses.kjv: And now the LORD your God hath given rest unto your brethren, as he promised them: therefore now return ye, and get you unto your tents, and unto the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of the LORD gave you on the other side Jordan.
verses.web: Now LORD your God has given rest to your brothers, as he spoke to them. Therefore now return and go to your tents, to the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of LORD gave you beyond the Jordan.
verses.ct: Now the LORD your God has given your brothers the peace he promised them. So go home. Return to your own land east of the Jordan — the territory that Moses, the servant of the LORD, gave you.

verses.kjv: But take diligent heed to do the commandment and the law, which Moses the servant of the LORD charged you, to love the LORD your God, and to walk in all his ways, and to keep his commandments, and to cleave unto him, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.web: Only take diligent heed to do the commandment and the law which Moses the servant of LORD commanded you, to love LORD your God, to walk in all his ways, to keep his commandments, to hold fast to him, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.”
verses.ct: But be very careful to follow the commands and the law that Moses, the servant of the LORD, gave you: love the LORD your God, walk in all his ways, keep his commandments, hold tight to him, and serve him with all your heart and all your soul."

verses.kjv: So Joshua blessed them, and sent them away: and they went unto their tents.
verses.web: So Joshua blessed them, and sent them away; and they went to their tents.
verses.ct: Then Joshua blessed them and sent them on their way, and they headed home.

verses.kjv: Now to the one half of the tribe of Manasseh Moses had given possession in Bashan: but unto the other half thereof gave Joshua among their brethren on this side Jordan westward. And when Joshua sent them away also unto their tents, then he blessed them,
verses.web: Now to the one half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had given inheritance in Bashan; but Joshua gave to the other half among their brothers beyond the Jordan westward. Moreover when Joshua sent them away to their tents, he blessed them,
verses.ct: Moses had given land in Bashan to one half of the tribe of Manasseh, while Joshua had given the other half their land among the rest of the tribes on the west side of the Jordan. As Joshua sent them off to their homes, he blessed them

verses.kjv: And he spake unto them, saying, Return with much riches unto your tents, and with very much cattle, with silver, and with gold, and with brass, and with iron, and with very much raiment: divide the spoil of your enemies with your brethren.
verses.web: and spoke to them, saying, “Return with much wealth to your tents, with very much livestock, with silver, with gold, with bronze, with iron, and with very much clothing. Divide the plunder of your enemies with your brothers.”
verses.ct: and said, "Go back to your homes with all your great wealth — your huge herds of livestock, your silver, gold, bronze, iron, and piles of clothing. Share the plunder you took from your enemies with the rest of your people."

verses.kjv: And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh returned, and departed from the children of Israel out of Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan, to go unto the country of Gilead, to the land of their possession, whereof they were possessed, according to the word of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
verses.web: The children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh returned, and departed from the children of Israel out of Shiloh, which is in the land of Canaan, to go to the land of Gilead, to the land of their possession, which they owned, according to the commandment of LORD by Moses.
verses.ct: So the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the other Israelites at Shiloh in Canaan and headed toward Gilead — the land they had been given as their own, just as the LORD had directed through Moses.

verses.kjv: And when they came unto the borders of Jordan, that are in the land of Canaan, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh built there an altar by Jordan, a great altar to see to.
verses.web: When they came to the region near the Jordan, that is in the land of Canaan, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an altar there by the Jordan, a great altar to look at.
verses.ct: When they reached the Jordan River region, still on the Canaan side, the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh built a massive, impressive altar there beside the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel heard say, Behold, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh have built an altar over against the land of Canaan, in the borders of Jordan, at the passage of the children of Israel.
verses.web: The children of Israel heard this, “Behold, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar along the border of the land of Canaan, in the region around the Jordan, on the side that belongs to the children of Israel.”
verses.ct: Word reached the rest of the Israelites: "The tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar right along the border of Canaan, in the Jordan region, on the Israelite side!"

verses.kjv: And when the children of Israel heard of it, the whole congregation of the children of Israel gathered themselves together at Shiloh, to go up to war against them.
verses.web: When the children of Israel heard of it, the whole congregation of the children of Israel gathered themselves together at Shiloh, to go up against them to war.
verses.ct: When the Israelites heard this, the entire community assembled at Shiloh, ready to go to war against them.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel sent unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh, into the land of Gilead, Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest,
verses.web: The children of Israel sent to the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, into the land of Gilead, Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest.
verses.ct: But first, the Israelites sent Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And with him ten princes, of each chief house a prince throughout all the tribes of Israel; and each one was an head of the house of their fathers among the thousands of Israel.
verses.web: With him were ten princes, one prince of a fathers’ house for each of the tribes of Israel; and they were each head of their fathers’ houses among the thousands of Israel.
verses.ct: With him went 10 leaders — one from each of the other tribes of Israel. Each man was the head of his family's clan, a leader over thousands in Israel.

verses.kjv: And they came unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh, unto the land of Gilead, and they spake with them, saying,
verses.web: They came to the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh, to the land of Gilead, and they spoke with them, saying,
verses.ct: They traveled to the land of Gilead and spoke to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh. They said,

verses.kjv: Thus saith the whole congregation of the LORD, What trespass is this that ye have committed against the God of Israel, to turn away this day from following the LORD, in that ye have builded you an altar, that ye might rebel this day against the LORD?
verses.web: “The whole congregation of LORD says, ‘What trespass is this that you have committed against the God of Israel, to turn away today from following LORD, in that you have built yourselves an altar, to rebel today against LORD?
verses.ct: "The entire assembly of the LORD demands to know: What is this act of betrayal you've committed against the God of Israel? You've turned your backs on the LORD today by building yourselves an altar — an outright rebellion against the LORD!

verses.kjv: Is the iniquity of Peor too little for us, from which we are not cleansed until this day, although there was a plague in the congregation of the LORD,
verses.web: Is the iniquity of Peor too little for us, from which we have not cleansed ourselves to this day, although there came a plague on the congregation of LORD,
verses.ct: Wasn't the sin at Peor enough for us? We still haven't fully cleansed ourselves from that, even though a plague struck the LORD's own community because of it.

verses.kjv: But that ye must turn away this day from following the LORD? and it will be, seeing ye rebel to day against the LORD, that to morrow he will be wroth with the whole congregation of Israel.
verses.web: that you must turn away today from following LORD? It will be, since you rebel today against LORD, that tomorrow he will be angry with the whole congregation of Israel.
verses.ct: And now you're turning away from the LORD today? If you rebel against the LORD today, tomorrow his anger will fall on the entire nation of Israel.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding, if the land of your possession be unclean, then pass ye over unto the land of the possession of the LORD, wherein the LORD’s tabernacle dwelleth, and take possession among us: but rebel not against the LORD, nor rebel against us, in building you an altar beside the altar of the LORD our God.
verses.web: However, if the land of your possession is unclean, then pass over to the land of the possession of LORD, in which LORD’s tabernacle dwells, and take possession among us; but don’t rebel against LORD, nor rebel against us, in building an altar other than LORD our God’s altar.
verses.ct: If your land is somehow unclean, then come across to the LORD's own territory where his tabernacle stands and settle among us. But don't rebel against the LORD — and don't rebel against us — by building an altar to rival the altar of the LORD our God.

verses.kjv: Did not Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in the accursed thing, and wrath fell on all the congregation of Israel? and that man perished not alone in his iniquity.
verses.web: Didn’t Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in the devoted thing, and wrath fell on all the congregation of Israel? That man didn’t perish alone in his iniquity.’ ”
verses.ct: Remember what happened when Achan son of Zerah violated the ban on devoted things? God's anger didn't fall on Achan alone — it struck the whole community of Israel. He wasn't the only one who paid for his sin."

verses.kjv: Then the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh answered, and said unto the heads of the thousands of Israel,
verses.web: Then the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh answered, and spoke to the heads of the thousands of Israel,
verses.ct: The tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh responded to the leaders of Israel's clans:

verses.kjv: The LORD God of gods, the LORD God of gods, he knoweth, and Israel he shall know; if it be in rebellion, or if in transgression against the LORD, (save us not this day,)
verses.web: “The Mighty One, God, LORD, the Mighty One, God, LORD, he knows; and Israel shall know: if it was in rebellion, or if in trespass against LORD (don’t save us today),
verses.ct: "The LORD God of gods, the LORD God of gods — he knows the truth! And Israel will know it too! If this was an act of rebellion or betrayal against the LORD, then don't spare us today!

verses.kjv: That we have built us an altar to turn from following the LORD, or if to offer thereon burnt offering or meat offering, or if to offer peace offerings thereon, let the LORD himself require it;
verses.web: that we have built us an altar to turn away from following LORD; or if to offer burnt offering or meal offering, or if to offer sacrifices of peace offerings, let LORD himself require it.
verses.ct: If we built this altar to turn away from the LORD, or to offer burnt offerings, grain offerings, or peace offerings on it, let the LORD himself hold us accountable.

verses.kjv: And if we have not rather done it for fear of this thing, saying, In time to come your children might speak unto our children, saying, What have ye to do with the LORD God of Israel?
verses.web: “If we have not out of concern done this, and for a reason, saying, ‘In time to come your children might speak to our children, saying, “What have you to do with LORD, the God of Israel?
verses.ct: No — the truth is we did this out of concern for the future. We worried that someday your descendants would say to ours, 'What do you have to do with the LORD, the God of Israel?

verses.kjv: For the LORD hath made Jordan a border between us and you, ye children of Reuben and children of Gad; ye have no part in the LORD: so shall your children make our children cease from fearing the LORD.
verses.web: For LORD has made the Jordan a border between us and you, you children of Reuben and children of Gad. You have no portion in LORD.” ’ So your children might make our children cease from fearing LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD made the Jordan a boundary between us and you, people of Reuben and Gad. You have no connection to the LORD.' Then your children would cause our children to stop fearing the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore we said, Let us now prepare to build us an altar, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice:
verses.web: “Therefore we said, ‘Let’s now prepare to build ourselves an altar, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice;
verses.ct: "So we said, 'Let's build an altar — not for burnt offerings or sacrifices,

verses.kjv: But that it may be a witness between us, and you, and our generations after us, that we might do the service of the LORD before him with our burnt offerings, and with our sacrifices, and with our peace offerings; that your children may not say to our children in time to come, Ye have no part in the LORD.
verses.web: but it will be a witness between us and you, and between our generations after us, that we may perform the service of LORD before him with our burnt offerings, with our sacrifices, and with our peace offerings;’ that your children may not tell our children in time to come, ‘You have no portion in LORD.’
verses.ct: but as a witness between us and you, and between our future generations, proving that we do worship the LORD in his presence with our burnt offerings, sacrifices, and peace offerings.' That way your descendants can never tell ours, 'You have no connection to the LORD.'

verses.kjv: Therefore said we, that it shall be, when they should so say to us or to our generations in time to come, that we may say again, Behold the pattern of the altar of the LORD, which our fathers made, not for burnt offerings, nor for sacrifices; but it is a witness between us and you.
verses.web: “Therefore we said, ‘It shall be, when they tell us or our generations this in time to come, that we shall say, “Behold the pattern of LORD’s altar, which our fathers made, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice; but it is a witness between us and you.” ’
verses.ct: "We figured that if they ever said that to us or our descendants in the future, we could point to this replica of the LORD's altar that our ancestors built — not for burnt offerings or sacrifices, but as a witness between us and you."

verses.kjv: God forbid that we should rebel against the LORD, and turn this day from following the LORD, to build an altar for burnt offerings, for meat offerings, or for sacrifices, beside the altar of the LORD our God that is before his tabernacle.
verses.web: “Far be it from us that we should rebel against LORD, and turn away today from following LORD, to build an altar for burnt offering, for meal offering, or for sacrifice, besides LORD our God’s altar that is before his tabernacle!”
verses.ct: "We would never rebel against the LORD or turn away from following him by building an altar for burnt offerings, grain offerings, or sacrifices to compete with the altar of the LORD our God that stands before his tabernacle!"

verses.kjv: And when Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation and heads of the thousands of Israel which were with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spake, it pleased them.
verses.web: When Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation, even the heads of the thousands of Israel that were with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spoke, it pleased them well.
verses.ct: When Phinehas the priest and the tribal leaders with him heard the explanation from the people of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh, they were satisfied.

verses.kjv: And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the children of Manasseh, This day we perceive that the LORD is among us, because ye have not committed this trespass against the LORD: now ye have delivered the children of Israel out of the hand of the LORD.
verses.web: Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest said to the children of Reuben, to the children of Gad, and to the children of Manasseh, “Today we know that LORD is among us, because you have not committed this trespass against LORD. Now you have delivered the children of Israel out of LORD’s hand.”
verses.ct: Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest told the people of Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh, "Today we know that the LORD is with us, because you haven't betrayed him. You've saved all of Israel from the LORD's judgment."

verses.kjv: And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, and the princes, returned from the children of Reuben, and from the children of Gad, out of the land of Gilead, unto the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and brought them word again.
verses.web: Phinehas the son of Eleazar the priest, and the princes, returned from the children of Reuben, and from the children of Gad, out of the land of Gilead, to the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and brought them word again.
verses.ct: Then Phinehas and the leaders left Gilead, returning from the tribes of Reuben and Gad to the land of Canaan, where they reported everything to the rest of the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And the thing pleased the children of Israel; and the children of Israel blessed God, and did not intend to go up against them in battle, to destroy the land wherein the children of Reuben and Gad dwelt.
verses.web: The thing pleased the children of Israel; and the children of Israel blessed God, and spoke no more of going up against them to war, to destroy the land in which the children of Reuben and the children of Gad lived.
verses.ct: The Israelites were relieved and praised God. They dropped all talk of going to war and destroying the land where the tribes of Reuben and Gad lived.

verses.kjv: And the children of Reuben and the children of Gad called the altar Ed: for it shall be a witness between us that the LORD is God.
verses.web: The children of Reuben and the children of Gad named the altar “A Witness Between Us that LORD is God.”
verses.ct: The tribes of Reuben and Gad named the altar "Ed" — meaning "Witness" — saying, "It is a witness between us that the LORD is God."
